author: Parella Lewis
title: High heat and humidity with isolated strong storms
text: WE CONTINUE TO FOLLOW THIS TROPICAL WAVE WHICH OFFICIALLY IS NOW AN INVEST. THIS IS INVEST 97 L EXPECTED TO MOVE OVER CUBA TODAY AS IT CONTINUES TO HEAD OUT TOWARD FLORIDA. SO WHERE IS IT GOING TO GO FROM THERE. WELL NOW WE’RE BEGINNING TO SEE A LITTLE BIT OF DEFINITION, A LITTLE BIT OF A CORE TO TRACK. AND OUR SPAGHETTI MODELS LOOK HOW IN UNISON THEY ARE BRINGING IT INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO, BUT NOT FOR LONG. CROSSING OVER FLORIDA AND THEN ENDING UP RIGHT ON THE COAST OF THE CAROLINAS, BRINGING SOME WIND AND RAIN TO OUR AREA. SO WHAT ABOUT THE TIMING ON THAT? WELL, AS WE GO THROUGHOUT THIS WEEKEND, HERE IT IS. BY THE WAY, YOU CAN KIND OF BARELY SEE IT, BARELY DEFINED. IT’S WEAK AND WEAKER SYSTEMS TYPICALLY GO WEST. SO OUT TO THE GULF AND THEN POTENTIALLY CROSSING OVER FLORIDA AND BY NEXT WEDNESDAY OR THURSDAY RIGHT ALONG THE COAST OF THE CAROLINAS, BRINGING SOME WIND AND RAIN THERE, POSSIBLY HURRICANE RECONNAISSANCE AIRCRAFT WILL BE OUT LATER TODAY TO INVESTIGATE IT FURTHER. SO AS WE GET UPDATES, WE’LL LET YOU KNOW. HEY, WE’VE GOT A COLD FRONT ON THE WAY. THIS COLD FRONT WILL LOWER OUR HUMIDITY A LITTLE BIT TOMORROW. A LITTLE BIT MORE ON SUNDAY, AND MONDAY. IT’S NOT GOING TO BE COOL. IT’S JUST GOING TO BE LESS HUMID AS WE TAKE A LOOK OUTSIDE. IT’S A WARM, DRY START TO THE DAY AS WE GO INTO THIS AFTERNOON. SOME OF THOSE ISOLATED, STRONGER THUNDERSTORMS BEGIN TO MOVE THROUGH THE MOUNTAINS AND THEN HEADING INTO LATE AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT, A FEW FIND THEIR WAY ACROSS THE UPSTATE. TOMORROW, HERE WE GO. TOMORROW MORNING YOU’RE DOING SOME HIKING. GET UP THERE AND ENJOY IT. BUT JUST KNOW IN THE AFTERNOON WE’VE GOT SOME MORE OF THOSE THUNDERSTORMS HEADING OUR WAY. AND YES, A FEW MORE FOR THE UPSTATE AS WELL. AS WE GO INTO SUNDAY, WE’LL BE A LITTLE BIT LESS HUMID, A LITTLE BIT COOLER, BUT WE’LL STILL HAVE ABOUT A 30 TO 40% CHANCE OF A FEW MORE OF THOSE ISOLATED AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS. HERE WE GO. LOOK AT THE BLUE. THAT’S WHERE WE’RE GOING TO BE A LITTLE THAT’S A LITTLE BIT LESS MOIST IN THE ATMOSPHERE. A LITTLE BIT LESS MOISTURE IN THE AIR. SO LESS HUMID CONDITIONS AS WE GO INTO SATURDAY, SUNDAY, POSSIBLY EVEN INTO MONDAY, LOOK AT ALL THAT HUMIDITY AND RAIN OFF TO THE COAST. BUT LOOK AT THAT AS WE GET INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. WE COULD CONTINUE THAT STRETCH OF A LITTLE LESS HUMID. SO GOOD NEWS THERE. IT WILL NOT BE THAT WAY TODAY. AND TOMORROW. CAN YOU SEE THAT THE FEELS LIKE TODAY UP TO ABOUT 106. THE FEELS LIKE TOMORROW ABOUT 101. SO IT’S GOING TO BE VERY HOT, VERY HUMID FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. NOT QUITE AS HOT AS WE GO INTO SUNDAY, MONDAY AND NOT QUITE AS HUMID IN THE MOUNTAINS. LOW 90S TODAY. AND IT FEELS LIKE IN THE MID AND UPPER 90S. THEN WE’RE RIG Advertisement Very hot and humid again Friday with highs back into the upper 90s with a "feels like" temperature up to about 106 for the Upstate. It will be in the low 90s with a “feels like” in the mid-90s for the mountains.A little less humid air works into the area heading further into the weekend.A cool front swings through, producing more isolated but strong thunderstorms Friday through Sunday. However, Sunday will have temps closer to the seasonal average of low 90s and slightly less humid air.Track rain and storms on the interactive radar here.Check the latest alerts in your area here.Watch live skycams from around the Carolinas here.Get your hour-by-hour and extended forecast here. GREENVILLE, S.C. — Very hot and humid again Friday with highs back into the upper 90s with a "feels like" temperature up to about 106 for the Upstate. It will be in the low 90s with a “feels like” in the mid-90s for the mountains. Advertisement A little less humid air works into the area heading further into the weekend. A cool front swings through, producing more isolated but strong thunderstorms Friday through Sunday. However, Sunday will have temps closer to the seasonal average of low 90s and slightly less humid air.
